required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Progestogen Supplementation in the Prevention of Recurrent Uterine Contraction in Preterm Labor
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double Blinded, Placebo Controlled Trial of Oral Progestogen Supplementation in the Prevention of Recurrent Uterine Contraction in Preterm Labor

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of oral progesterone supplementation in preterm labor on the prevention of recurrent uterine contraction and prolonging pregnancy period, and its side effect.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The recurrence of uterine contraction within 48 hours after stop tocolytic

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from preterm labor pain to delivery
Number of newborn with respiratory distress syndrome
Number of newborn with intraventricular hemorrhage
Number of newborn with necrotizing enterocolitis

arm_group.description: tocolytic + corticosteroids + Dydrogesterone 10 mg/tablet prepare in capsule, 1 cap oral every 12 hours, starting form enrollment until gestational age 37 weeks
tocolytic + corticosteroids + Placebo prepare in capsule, 1 cap oral every 12 hours, starting form enrollment until gestational age 37 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton pregnancy
- Preterm labor
- GA24-34wk
- Intact membranes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Maternal/fetal condition requiring immediate delivery ex. Chorioamnionitis, fetal distress
- Placenta previa
- medical and obstetric complications
- allergy to dydrogesterone
